column4: hi guys...   short question. i got ma gnome panel reallly messed up...  by adding an applet "swallow" to the panel..  now I can neither click on the panel properties anymore nor  removing that applet any ideas?
what a STUPID panel applet this swallow thing.. btw
thx IdleOne, :) thx ubottu bot...   IdleOne do you know , whether  there would be any option to just remove that one applet which messed up everything? I don't want to reconfigure my panel :)
ahh..  thx.. I will try that
ps au | grep swallow or whatever the applet is called
will the applet than be removed automatically for my next login?
the kill PIDNUMBER. that should stop the applet, then remove/uninstall it
but how do I remove it? when I killed it, it will not show up in the panel enymore...
ahh.. lol i can just uninstall it.. of course
jesus..  it has been a long work day
my brain works like a snail

ok.. IdleOne that worked... thx...  do you know whether there is a "generic" way to get a new ".profile" file in my home dirctory, since I accidentally deleted mine doesn't seem to be replaced by ubuntu though (I wonder if I need it then, anyway, because my .bashrc is still working...) its just that my ~/bin directory stopped working since then..  the path directory usually gets updated by the .profile i guess...
